group_1.narration: This strange dream reminding me of my first love...
I wonder if my inner regret is telling me to@face this love again.

group_1.textCenter: That part, your rests are a bit long. They're a bit@more pronounced than the score suggests.
Also, the high notes you managed to hit earlier@are absent.

group_1.textLeft: Phew...

group_1.textRight: Ahh, we finally get a break.@He's really too strict.
Even students in the other clubs are saying@that the Vocal Music Club sucks.
He's always like that, even in math class.
So spartan and old-fashioned!@Don't you agree, Sasha?

group_1.textLeft: Y-yes... It's better to be gentle.

group_1.textRight: I don't even get time to hang out with@my boyfriend!

group_1.textCenter: Hey, freshmen, break time's over.

group_1.textLeft: Huh, already?

group_1.textRight: But our break just started...
Singing is so exhausting!

group_1.textCenter: That's right, singing is exhausting.
However, this level of exhaustion is because@your body isn't used to singing...
The goals for your year are to practice frequently@and train your body so you can sing for a long time.
Okaaaay...

group_1.narration: Teacher didn't have a very good reputation.@He was a bit sullen and strict,@and I could never tell what he was thinking...
At that time,@I may have also been feeling dissatisfied with him,@to the extent that I chimed in with everyone's complaints.
At that time, I was still...

group_1.textRight: All right, the club's finally over.
My boyfriend's waiting for me.@See you later, Sasha.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, see you later♪

group_1.textCenter: (I want to sing a little more...)
(I used to be in a choir, so I'm accustomed@to singing, but...)
(Teacher was correct about practice@being exhausting...)
(Perhaps I can practice at the park...@No, it's nearly closing time...)
(If I did it at home, I'd disturb the neighbors...)
(Maybe there's a suitable place to practice@at school...)
(But if I practice in a classroom,@someone might see me.)
(And the music room is supposed to be locked@to prevent theft...)
(As should the rest of the club rooms...)
(Most of them must be locked...)
Oh, I know!
There's one place that may be suitable.@The rooftop!
Thank goodness, the door was unlocked.
Unlike the schoolyard, I can freely practice here@without worrying about being seen.

group_1.textLeft: Who's there?

group_1.textCenter: [chara:103501:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Eeek?

group_1.textRight: ...Oh, Teacher... Why in the world would@you be here...?

group_1.textLeft: Same to you, Kurusu...@What are you doing here?

group_1.textRight: Well... I wished to practice on my own...
I received a lot of scolding during the club earlier...
Oh, but I suppose...@I won't be able to use the roof, yes?
I'll be on my way...

group_1.textLeft: Hold on.

group_1.textRight: Hm?

group_1.textLeft: It's fine. I'm the one who was hard on you, so...

group_1.textRight: Huh, are you sure?

group_1.textLeft: Students aren't allowed to be alone on the roof@after school.
But if you're under teacher supervision, it's fine.

group_1.textRight: What, supervision?

group_1.textLeft: I'll accompany you with practice until it's@time to lock up.
...Is that a problem...?

group_1.textRight: Oh, no! I'd much appreciate it!@Please do!
Oh my, I feel like I can produce my voice@a little more easily now♪

group_1.textLeft: You've been good at singing from the diaphragm@since the start.

group_1.textRight: Thank you very much.
It's because I used to be in a choir♪
...Ah, you don't seem very pleased about that...

group_1.textLeft: Children's choir is where you learn@the joy of singing.
So it does play an important role, but...
Sometimes it focuses more on winning competitions@than building up your skills.
If you find the current practice too demanding...
You have to work on your endurance first.
Now, you should head home.@I can't allow you to stay out too late.
Just go home and rest your throat...
What is it?

group_1.textRight: Um, may I come back here tomorrow?@I want to improve.

group_1.textLeft: Of course...
...not.

group_1.textRight: Whyyyyyy...?!

group_1.narration: Ahhh, how nostalgic...@That's how Teacher and I began our independent practice.
However, love has yet to blossom...
